meanings.definition: An inadequate blood supply to an organ or part of the body, especially the heart muscles.
meanings.sent1: Ischemia can cause damage to the heart muscles.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are concerned about the ischemia affecting the patient's heart.
meanings.sent3: The heart felt a bit neglected due to the ischemia, so it decided to take a break.
meanings.sent4: The ischemia was like a roadblock preventing the heart from getting the oxygen it needed.
meanings.sent5: The ischemia cast a shadow over the heart, depriving it of life-giving blood.

meanings.definition: Local anemia due to mechanical obstruction of the blood supply.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with ischemia in the affected area.
meanings.sent2: The ischemia in the leg was causing discomfort for the patient.
meanings.sent3: The ischemia in the arm made it feel like it was on a traffic jam.
meanings.sent4: The ischemia acted like a dam, blocking the flow of blood to the area.
meanings.sent5: The ischemia painted the area pale, draining it of its usual color.
